metadata.synopsis: Otik (Janos Ban) is mentally challenged and single. Pavek (Marián Labuda) is a put-upon family man. Co-workers in a small town, their jobs involve making deliveries in an old truck, but Otik has a habit of botching simple tasks. Because of his co-worker's errors, Pavek says he's eager to be rid of his friend. But with Otik on the verge of carving out a new, independent life, the men realize that they depend upon one another much more than they'd realized.

reviews: My Sweet Little Village, faithful to the standards of Czech comedy, is an enjoyable film. [Full Review in Spanish]
You end up siding with "My Sweet Little Village" as it rejoices in the texture of an ordinary community.
The great Czech director Jiri Menzel (Closely Watched Trains) received an Oscar nomination for this charming, episodic tale.
